alert.note: Alert for Northern Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 22 at 4:09AM AKST until February 23 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, Blowing snow with poor visibility and winds chill near 45 below. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 PM AKST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from this evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Large snow drifts will develop impacting travel in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chill values will moderate this morning as temperatures rise. Winds will diminish some this afternoon and increase in the evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
